sorular.soru: What is this sign warning you of?

feedback.metin: The J-33 sign indicates that you are approaching a traffic jam. This traffic sign is usually indicated on the electronic signs. If this is not the case, a bottom sign often indicates the conditions under which traffic jams occur.

sorular.soru: Where are you required to use lights at night when parked on the carriageway?
cevaplar: Within and outside of built-up areas.

feedback.metin: If you park on a carriageway outside built-up areas, you are required to use sidelights and rear lights during the day and at night when visibility is poor. This is not compulsory in built-up areas.

sorular.soru: Do you have to have insurance for a car which is parked on your driveway and unused for an extended period of time?

feedback.metin: All motor carriages that are registered on someone's name in the national vehicle register, have to have insurance. Even if they are not used for an extended period of time. The only way to avoid having to insure your vehicle is to suspend it. But then the vehicle must also be completely withdrawn from traffic. So for instance, parked in a garage or in your backyard. The CBR will not ask questions about such exceptions.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive on the right lane here as well?

feedback.metin: The rightmost lane may only be used by bus drivers. You are driving in the correct lane here. This is your rightmost lane.

sorular.soru: What should you take into account if you want to get out of the car in this extended traffic jam?

feedback.metin: When traffic comes to a standstill for an extended period, many drivers want to exit their vehicle. Because motorcyclists are allowed to pass traffic jams between the two left-hand lanes, drivers must check their surroundings before opening the vehicle door. You must also keep a close eye on other traffic and avoid walking away from your vehicle, as traffic may start moving at any time. Stay in your vehicle as much as possible and keep in mind that emergency services may use the hard shoulder.

sorular.soru: Can you park like this for a short amount of time?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park your vehicle on the road next to another vehicle; this is referred to as double parking. You may, however, briefly stop to load or unload goods or to pick up or drop off passengers. These are not categorised as parking.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum height of a trailer including load?

feedback.metin: The height of a trailer including the load may never exceed 4 metres.

sorular.soru: The indivisible load is protruding 60 cm at the front of the trailer. Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: A protruding indivisible load at the front of a trailer is prohibited. Long, indivisible loads may protrude with a maximum of 1 metre from the front of a passenger car, but not from a trailer.

sorular.soru: Is this sufficient lateral distance?

feedback.metin: Bicycles are balance vehicles just like mopeds, snorfietsen and motorcycles. While riding, they sway somewhat. Therefore, when overtaking, you should always maintain a safe and wide lateral passing distance of at least one to one and a half metres. If this is not possible, it is better to wait before overtaking.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: You are reversing around a bend, which is a special manoeuvre. When executing a special manoeuvre, you must give way to all other traffic, including pedestrians.

sorular.soru: What should you do when you are overtaken by the red car on the right?
cevaplar: Let the other driver go first.
Accelerate so that overtaking does not work.
Flash your lights as a warning.
sorular.dogruCevap: Let the other driver go first.

feedback.metin: In theory, overtaking should always be on the left. If you are overtaken by another vehicle on the right instead of the left, in an area where this is forbidden, do not play police officer. This is risky behaviour. Allow the other driver to overtake safely. Make sure you do not unnecessarily enter the left lane, as this may cause other drivers to overtake on the right. If this is the case, move to the right as soon as it is safe to do so.

sorular.soru: Should you move one lane to the right here?

feedback.metin: You can see from the blue signs that you are approaching a taper junction. The drivers that are approaching on the right carriageway must keep space to be able to get in lane. The left lane of that carriageway merges together with the right lane on the carriageway you are driving on. If you move one lane to the right now, this can make it harder for drivers in the other lane to get in lane and cause problems.

sorular.soru: What do you do if this warning light stays on?
cevaplar: Stop in a safe place and call the breakdown service for advice.
Keep driving until the warning light goes out.
Do not turn off the engine and drive directly to the nearest garage.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop in a safe place and call the breakdown service for advice.

feedback.metin: The battery light comes on every time you start the vehicle. Once you start driving, it should turn off automatically. If the battery light remains on, or suddenly lights up while you are driving, this means your battery is no longer being charged. This usually indicates a malfunctioning alternator, power cables, drive belt, or battery. Stop in a safe place as soon as possible and call the breakdown service or a garage for advice. In the past, drivers were advised to continue driving in this situation. In modern cars, however, continuing to drive is unwise as reduced battery voltage can result in the failure of important systems.

sorular.soru: Are you obligated to use a child restraint system when transporting a child who is 1.25 metres in length?

feedback.metin: When you transport a person under the age of 18 years and less than 1.35 metres in length, using a child restraint system is mandatory. A child who is 1.25 metres in length should therefore be transported in a child restraint system. Normally, a booster seat is used in this case.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to continue driving if the motorcyclist does not give you priority?

feedback.metin: You are never allowed to take priority, you have to receive it. Does someone not give you priority? React in a defensive way by stopping yourself. You have to negate accidents at all times.

sorular.soru: Are pregnant women also required to wear a three-point seat belt?
cevaplar: No. Only as a hip belt below the stomach.
Yes. This is required for everybody.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. This is required for everybody.

feedback.metin: Just like everyone else, pregnant women are required to use a three-point seat belt. Pregnant women should always wear the hip part of the three-point belt as low as possible over the pelvis.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with your dipped headlights here?

feedback.metin: It is not mandatory to drive with your dipped headlights when you have a good field of view during the day. However, it is allowed and in general sensible to do so.

sorular.soru: Are drivers of a brommobiel allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: The C-15 sign means: Closed to bicycles, mopeds, and disabled vehicles. Roads, where the C-15 sign is placed, are also closed to snorfietsen and speed pedelecs. The sign does not apply to drivers of a brommobiel. They are allowed to drive here.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive faster than 30 km/h here?

feedback.metin: This sign only indicates a recommended speed. It is wise to stick to this recommended speed, as the sign is there for a reason. But driving faster, if safe, is not prohibited.

sorular.soru: Which cyclist is not visible in your mirrors?
cevaplar: The cyclist diagonally behind the car
The cyclist next to the car
sorular.dogruCevap: The cyclist next to the car

feedback.metin: The cyclist behind and diagonally behind the car are visible in the mirrors, if they are adjusted correctly. The cyclist next to the car is not visible in the mirrors. This one is riding in your blind spot. To be able to see him, you will have to look closely beside you.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here?

feedback.metin: Overtaking in foggy weather is not safe because of limited visibility. If overtaking is not safe, it is not allowed.

sorular.soru: At what point in this situation do you indicate right?

feedback.metin: If you want to exit the roundabout immediately, indicate right before joining the roundabout. This lets other drivers know where you are going so they can react in time, as well as improving traffic flow.

sorular.soru: When should you indicate here?
cevaplar: As soon as the block marking starts.
As soon as you are on the merge lane.

feedback.metin: When driving in this lane, you must adapt your speed as much as possible to the traffic on the main carriageway. You must only indicate when you have a safe opportunity to join the main carriageway. After checking your blind spot again, you slowly move to the left.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: The E-4 sign is placed at the beginning of a lay-by, a parking strip, or at the entrance to a car park. This sign indicates that you can park here.

sorular.soru: How deep should the main grooves of a tyre be?

feedback.metin: The tyre must have a minimum tread depth of 1.6 mm in the main grooves over the entire circumference. The tyre's tread ensures good drainage and prevents aquaplaning.

sorular.soru: You have good visibility in the wing mirrors but no visibility in the rear-view mirror due to cargo. Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: A rear-view mirror is mandatory, but if cargo prevents you from seeing in the rear-view mirror, you are allowed to drive. This is not allowed if visibility in the wing mirrors is obstructed. You must also always maintain adequate visibility through the windscreen and front side windows.

sorular.soru: Does using cruise control save energy?

feedback.metin: Cruise control regulates a constant speed, so you brake and accelerate less often. As a result, cruise control ensures lower energy consumption.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake like this?

feedback.metin: Driving on hatched road markings is always prohibited. Hatched road markings are parts of a carriageway painted with diagonal stripes and are usually seen when the number of lanes on a carriageway change.

sorular.soru: What should you do before driving?
cevaplar: Clear the windscreen and front side windows of snow.
Clear the whole car of snow.
sorular.dogruCevap: Clear the whole car of snow.

feedback.metin: You must clear the whole car of snow. According to the law, you are required to have a clear view through the windscreen and the front side windows next to the driver. The lights and the registration plate must also be visible. In addition, pieces of snow and ice blowing off your car while driving may pose a danger to other traffic and is therefore forbidden.

sorular.soru: What is this sign warning you of?

feedback.metin: When you see the J-21 sign, you must adjust your speed early and be aware of children crossing the road. This sign is often used to indicate you are approaching a school, a playground, or another area frequented by children.

sorular.soru: Is it safe to merge here at 60 km/h?

feedback.metin: Merging safely means merging at the speed being driven on the main carriageway. You can see from the hectometre sign and the presence of a hard shoulder that you are entering a motorway where other traffic is travelling at about 100 to 130 km/h. There are no traffic jams. If you merge at too low a speed, this can be dangerous for other drivers. Although merging at 60 km/h is not prohibited, it is unsafe in this situation.

sorular.soru: When must a trailer have a number plate with its own registration number?
cevaplar: When the maximum weight exceeds 750 kg.
When the maximum weight exceeds 1500 kg.
sorular.dogruCevap: When the maximum weight exceeds 750 kg.

feedback.metin: If your trailer has a maximum weight of more than 750 kg, it must have a yellow number plate with its own registration number. Lighter trailers must have a white number plate, but with the registration number of the towing vehicle. This also applies to bicycle carriers mounted on the tow bar.

sorular.soru: Where is the motorcyclist allowed to pass the traffic jam?

feedback.metin: The motorcyclist may pass slow moving and stationary traffic jams in between the two leftmost lanes. This means they may pass you on the left side. You can keep this into account by driving a little more to the right of your lane, in places where this is possible.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here at 9:00 PM?

feedback.metin: You are driving on a motorway where a sign indicates a speed limit of 100 km/h applies.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: Stopping or parking on or within 5 metres of a pedestrian crossing is prohibited.
